snippet: The Shiite rebels of the Houthi group spurned the choice of Ahmed Awad bin Mubarak, putting a September peace deal in jeopardy.
abstract: Houthi rebels, who control Yemen's capital, spurn Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi's choice of Ahmed Awad bin Mubarak as new prime minister because he is close associate of Hadi and is not seen as independent; move threatens to derail a United Nations-brokered peace deal.
lead_paragraph: The Shiite rebels of the Houthi group spurned the choice of Ahmed Awad bin Mubarak, putting a September peace deal in jeopardy.

headline.main: Rebels in Yemen Reject New Premier
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Yemen Reject New Premier
